task_prompts: Where is your hometown?
Do you like your hometown? Why?
How long have you been living in your hometown?
Do you believe it is a proper place to grow up? Why
How could your hometown be improved?
Has your hometown changed much since you were a child?
Is there good public transportation in your hometown?
Will you be moving away from your hometown?
Do you usually wear T-shirts?
Do you like T-shirts with pictures or prints?
Do you think older people are fashionable if they wear T-shirts?
Have you ever bought T-shirts as souvenirs?
Are there wild animals in your country?
Have you ever been to a zoo or a safari park?
What is the animal you like to see in the wild?
Are there TV programs about wild animals in your country?
What is your favorite day of the week?
What is your least favorite day of the week?
What is the busiest day of the week for you?
Is there anything that you do every day?？
Are weekdays and weekends the same for you?
What city do you live in?
Do you like this city? Why?
How long have you lived in this city?
Are there big changes in this city?
Is this city your permanent residence?
Do you like eating chocolate? Why or why not?
What is your favorite flavor of chocolate?
Do you think it is good to use chocolate as gifts to others?
How often do you eat chocolate?
Did you often eat chocolate when you were a kid?
Why do you think chocolate is popular around the world?
Describe an interesting old person you met.
You should say:
who this person is
when/where you met this person
what you did
and explain why you think this old person is interesting.
Describe someone you know who often helps others.
You should say:
what he/she is like
how he/she helps others
why his/her help is beneficial
and explain why he/she helps others
Describe a time when you talked to a group of people.
You should say:
when it happened
who you talked to
why you gave this talk
and explain how you felt about the talk.
Describe a complaint you made and were satisfied with the result.
You should say:
when it happened
who you complained to
what you complained about
and why you were satisfied with the result
Describe a time when you missed or were late for a meeting.
You should say:
when it happened
what happened
why you missed/were late for it
and explain how you felt about this experience.
Describe a new shop that recently opened in your city/town.
You should say:
where the shop is
what it sells
what kinds of people usually go to this shop
and explain how successful you think it will be in the future.
Describe a water sport you want to learn in the future.
You should say:
what it is
what you need to do this sport
why you want to learn this sport
and explain whether it is difficult or easy to learn this sport.
Is it easy for old people and young people to make friends with each other?
Do you think old people and young people can have common interests?
What can old people teach young people?
How can children help their parents at home?
Should students do community service? Why?
Why do some people do volunteer work all over the world?
Should children be taught to help each other?
What benefits does the Internet bring to communication?
Which one is better, being a talker or a listener?
What qualities does a communicator need to have?
When are people more likely to make complaints?
Which is better when making a complaint, by talking or writing?
How would you react if you received poor service at a restaurant?
Who is more likely to complain, older or younger people?
Do you think it is important to be on time?
Why do people miss important events?
Are you a punctual person?
Are people in your country often late for meetings?
What kinds of shops are popular in your city?
Why do young people enjoy shopping in boutiques?
Do you think location is the critical factor determining customer volume?
How important are price and quality in influencing consumer behavior?
What is the difference between a small shop and large shop?
Are there any methods to improve the popularity of shops?
What are the advantages and disadvantages of water transport?
What are the popular water sports in your country?
Do you think schools should teach children how to swim?
Are there many people in your country who often go diving?
What subjects are you studying?
Why did you decide to study those subjects?
Do you like your subject?
Do you prefer to study in the mornings or the afternoons?
Do you miss being a student?
Is it exciting?
Are you looking forward to working?
Why did you choose to do that work (or that job)?
Do you like your job?
Is it exciting?
Do you often stay up late?
Did you stay up late when you were a kid?
What do you do when you stay up late?
What does it feel like the following day when you stay up late?
What languages do you speak?
Why do you learn English?
Do you think it's challenging to learn a new language?
Will you learn another in the future?
Do you like rainy days?
Does it rain much in your city?
Would you like to live in a dry or wet place?
Do you remember your teachers from primary school?
Do you have a favorite teacher?
Do you want to be a teacher in the future?
Do you like weekends?
What do you usually do on weekends? Do you study or work?
What did you do last weekend?
Do you have plans for your weekends?
Describe a time when you taught a friend or relative something.
You should say:
who you taught
what you taught
how the result was
and explain how you felt about the experience
Describe a piece of good news that you heard about someone you know well.
You should say:
what it was
when you hear it
how you knew it
and explain how you felt about it
Describe an occasion when you lost your way.
You should say:
where you were
what happened
how you felt about it
and explain how you found your way.
Describe a traditional celebration in your country.
You should say:
what it is
when it is held
how it is celebrated
and explain how you feel about this celebration.
Describe someone you know who has recently moved to a new place.
You should say:
who he/she is
what the new place is like
why he/she moved to this place.
Describe an apartment or a house that you would like to have.
You should say:
what it is like
where it would be
why you would like to have such a place
and explain how you feel about the place.
Describe a time when you saved money to buy an expensive gift for others.
You should say:
What it was
Why you wanted to buy this gift
How long you saved money for it
And explain how you felt when you bought the gift.
Describe a difficult decision you once made.
You should say:
what the decision was
when you made this decision
how long it took to make the decision
and explain why it was difficult to make the decision.
Describe a place you went to where there are a lot of people.
You should say:
what the decision was
when you made this decision
how long it took to make the decision
and explain why it was difficult to make the decision.
What practical skills can young people teach old people?
Do you think “showing” is better than “telling” in education?
Do people in your country like to watch videos to learn something?
How can we know what to do when we want to learn something new?
Why do older people have problems learning new things?
Is it good to share something on social media?
Should the media only publish good news?
How does social media help people access information?
What kind of good news do people often share in the community?
How can people find their way when they are lost?
Why do some people get lost more quickly than others?
Is a paper map still necessary?
Are there any festivals that have already disappeared in your country?
Why do you think some traditional festivals are still celebrated by people (while others already disappeared)?
Why should children learn about traditions?
Are there any particular music or snacks involved when people celebrate traditional festivals?
Is it a positive thing for young people to live by themselves?
Apart from cooking, are there any other skills people need to learn if they live independently?
What kinds of people tend to live by themselves?
Why do some young people keep moving?
What's the difference between living alone and living with roommates?
What's the difference between an apartment and a house?
What is the most common architectural style of buildings in your country?
What difficulties do people have living in the city?
What can be done to reduce the stress of city life?
Are you good at saving money?
Do you think it is hard for people to save money nowadays?
Do you think children should have pocket money?
What do young people save money for?
What important decisions do young people need to make after graduation?
Do you think children sometimes have to make important decisions?
Who can children turn to for help when making decisions?
What kinds of places are often crowded with many people?
Do you think young people usually wait patiently in crowded places?
What types of people do not like to go to crowded places?
What are the advantages of living on an upper floor?
What do you think of people queuing up in restaurants for over an hour?
Do you live in a house or a flat?
Why do you live in an apartment/house?
How long have you lived there?
What do you like the most about it?
What is your favorite room? Why?
Can you describe the view from your windows?
Do you plan to live there in the future?
What are the advantages of living in your own home?
What kind of accommodation do you wish to have in the future?
Can you tell me about your house when you were a child?
Have you ever learned about outer space and stars?
Are you interested in films concerning outer space and stars?
Do you want to go into outer space in the future?
What made you happy when you were little?
Is there anything that has made you feel happy lately?
What do you think will make you feel happy in the future?
Are you happy when you buy new things?
Do you think you are an ambitious person?
What was your dream when you were a child?
What is your main ambition in life now?
Are you the kind of person who never gives up on the dream?
Do you have many friends?
How important are friends to you?
Where do you often meet?
What do you usually do with your friends?
Do you usually carry a bag?
What kinds of bags do you like?
Do you often change bags?
Describe a new development (e.g., a shopping mall) in your town or city.
You should say:
what the development is
when/where you notice it
how long it took to complete it
and explain how you feel about it
Describe a place you visited where the air was polluted.
You should say:
where the place is
when you visited there
why the air was polluted
and explain how you felt about the place
Describe another city you would like to stay in for a short time.
You should say:
where it is
who you will stay there with
what you will do in the city
and explain why you would stay there for a short time.
Describe a game you played in your childhood.
You should say:
what the game was
where you played it
who you played it with
and explain how you felt about the game.
What can be improved in public transport services?
What leisure facilities can be used by people of all ages?
Do you think young people in your country like to go to the cinema?
How is the subway system developing in your country?
In what ways can air quality be improved effectively?
Do you think the city is cleaner or dirtier than the countryside? Why?
Is there more pollution now than in the past?
Do you think the wind has any effect on air pollution? How?
Why do people sometimes go to other cities or other countries to travel?
Why do places with historical sites develop the tourism industry more actively?
Do you think tourists may come across bad things in other cities?
Do most people like planning travel?
Do you think children today still like to play traditional games compared to computer games?
Do young people want to play alone or with others?
Is winning important in games?
What can you learn from games?
Where are you living now?
What do you like most about where you live?
What is the neighborhood like where you live?
Do you have any friends there?
What can be improved in the area where you live?
Do you know any famous people in the area where you live?
Do you intend to stay in this area in the future?
Do you know many small businesses where you live?
Do you prefer buying things from big companies or small businesses?
Have you ever worked in small businesses?
Have you ever thought about starting your own business?
